Pricing: Personal plans: Free/7 days, $11.99/month, $53.94/6 months, $59.88/year, $119.76/2 years, $107.64/3 years; Business plans: 10 connections/$155.88/month, 20 connections/$287.88/month, 30 connections/$395.88/month;
Payment Information: Debit/Credit Card: Visa, American Express, MasterCard, Discover; PayPal; Google Pay; Union Pay; Apple Pay; Bleue; Hipercard; Boletol; iDeal; QIWI Wallet; elo; Sofort Banking; Alipay; PayNearMe; giropay; POLi; Nordea; Pohjola; Konbini; WireTransfer;
Other Devices: Routers, Apple TV, Android TV, PlayStation. Xbox;
Server Locations: Canada, Cyprus, Monaco, Serbia, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, Samoa, Fiji, Guam, Nauru, Palau, Guinea, Cambodia, China, Georgia, India, Indonesia, Iraq, Israel, Japan, Jordan, Kazakhstan, Kuwait, Kyrgyzstan, Lebanon, Malaysia, Maldives, Mongolia, Myanmar, Nepal, Oman, Pakistan, Philippines, Qatar, Singapore, Tajikistan, Thailand, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, Yemen, Belize, Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, Panama, Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, Guyana, Paraguay, Peru, Suriname, Uruguay, Anguilla, Aruba, Bahamas, Barbados, Bermuda, Cuba, Dominica, Grenada, Guadeloupe, Haiti, Jamaica, Montserrat, Algeria, Angola, Benin, Botswana, Burundi, Cameroon, Chad, Comoros, Congo, Egypt, Eritrea, Eswatini, Ethiopia, Gabon, Gambia, Ghana, Guinea-Bissau, Kenya, Lesotho,  Liberia,ï¿½Libya, Madagascar, Malawi, Mali, Mauritania, Mauritius, Morocco, Mozambique, Namibia, Niger, Nigeria, Djibouti, Rwanda, Senegal, Somalia, Sudan, Togo, Tunisia, Uganda, Zambia, Zimbabwe
Data Retained: Email address, username, activation code, subscription renewal date, originating IP address, request timestamps, billing data, user agent, application events;
Payment Data: Email address, card number, car holder anme, expiration date, cvc code, country, state/province, city, ZIP code;
Data Retention Timeline: Personal data is retained for the management of account. Anonymous usage data is retained for 2 years;
Notes: HMA VPN claims to have no logs, but police accessed their records to arrest a few users, most notably Cody Kretsinger of the LulzSec group. Headquarters are in the UK which is part of the Five-Eyes aliance and has a reputation of being privacy-unfriendly.
Recent News: Was audited in April 2020 an became an official no-logs VPN.
